Description: Key Job Responsibilities: Supports development of quality plans, procedures, and systems (e.g. discrepancy recording system (DRS)). The discrepancy recording system is a Solumina-based system that is used to generate and disposition non-conforming product on a discrepancy report (DR). MRB members use DRS to generate the discrepancy reports. Information is stored within the DRS such as pictures of the non-conformance, non-conformance descriptions, and implemented corrective actions. Ensures the conformance to company and regulatory standards. Initiates, reviews, analyzes and reports on quality-related data/metrics from production, service, supplier or process improvement activities and analyzes using statistical techniques. Interfaces as needed with manufacturing, engineering, customer, vendor and subcontractor representatives to ensure process requirements are met. Supports the development of disposition and corrective actions for recurring product/process discrepancies for both make and buy items. Reviews completed assembly, process, test, mechanical, electrical, and electromechanical quality records to determine data accuracy, acceptability and completeness. Manages the quality records control process to assure adequate accountability and traceability. Develops and maintains governing procedures related to records control. Supports product acceptance and delivery per established process.  Responsible for collecting, processing, and analyzing data to develop immersive stories that answer business questions. Using proven and sound statistical methods, the analyst draws insights from data, and translates those insights into action that drive business results. Apply mathematical and statistical methods to business and risk management problems. Mine, process, and summarize data; Manage the quality assurance of data scraping, query databases for stakeholder requests, and triage data issues for timely resolutions; Analyze large datasets, draw valid inferences and prepare insights in narrative or visual forms, including dashboards; Set up and maintain data processes and new analytics capabilities; Produce and track key performance indicators; Ability to formulate functional and technical requirements from business problems.  The candidate will also provide leadership through identification and implementation of process improvement efforts, as well as cross-functional collaboration, in the corresponding RMS Quality initiatives including, but not limited to: Root Cause Analysis, Digital Transformation, and Data Analytics. Knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) and how these concepts can be applied to improve our conformity inspection processes as well as reduce process and product variation.  Basic Qualifications: Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education Considered career, or journey, level. Ability to balance teaming and flexibility while maintaining independence and ensuring process adherence.  Demonstrated Full Spectrum Leadership skills.  Experience building a strong team of direct and matrixed employees.  Demonstrated ability to drive process improvement and drive change.  Strong working knowledge of problem solving/root cause analysis and process management.  Ability to think and act strategically.  Ability to give, receive, and act on critical feedback.  Ability to form creative partnerships to improve execution and competitive performance.  Desired Skills: Master’s Degree in Business or Engineering related discipline  Experienced in implementing and maintaining AS9100-certified Quality Management Systems  Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma Tools  Engineering Quality Experience  Knowledge of Data Analytics including Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI)  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications   Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Position Narrative (Overview) As part of our Product Development team, SageSure is seeking an associate data scientist who will develop and implement data science solutions. In this role, you'll have opportunities to work side by side with data scientists to tackle challenging initiatives aimed at improving pricing sophistication and enabling the profitable growth of our residential property group. If you're ready to join an innovative team at a best-in-class insurance and technology company, we want to hear from you.  What you'll be doing: Collaborate with Actuarial, Underwriting, Claims, and Innovation teams to understand business needs Work closely with Data Management to ensure data integrity and enhance the data pipeline Perform and interpret appropriate exploratory analysis such as data mining, empirical data analysis, univariate analysis, partitioning analysis, etc. Develop model-driven solutions to complex business problems, such as relying upon GLM using R for pricing Build dashboards to visualize model results Explore machine learning techniques (Random Forest, Lasso, Elastic Net, Boosting, etc.) to build complex non-pricing models  We're looking for someone who has: Masters in a quantitative studies discipline required Solid knowledge of linear model and statistical inference Experience with predictive modeling and statistical software packages (e.g. Python/R) to build complex models Experience using SQL to query and clean up data Microsoft office and database skills Effective interpersonal and written / verbal communication skills; a strong team player with the ability to work across organizational boundaries Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent organizational skills  Highly preferred candidates also have: Prior internship or P&C insurance experience PhD in a quantitative studies discipline  If shaping the future of an industry sounds exciting, you’ll love working at SageSure! A Best Places to Work in Insurance Recipient for two years in a row (2020-2021), SageSure is a managing general underwriter leader and insurance technology innovator serving disaster-prone areas. That means we sell insurance through our proprietary technology platform in places other insurance companies won’t do business. Our success in delivering coverage in America’s most challenging markets is the result of our strategic focus to understand and adequately price risk. We offer 50+ products in 14 states, serving over 400,000 policyholders while managing more than $800 million in written premium. We have nine office locations—Jersey City, NJ; Mountain View, CA; Atlanta, GA; Chicago, IL; Tallahassee, FL; Cincinnati, OH; Houston, TX; Mt. Laurel, NJ; and Cheshire, CT—as well as numerous remote employees across the country. We provide generous health benefits and perks, including tuition reimbursement, wellness allowance, paid volunteer time off, a matching 401K plan and more. SageSure fosters inclusion, creating an environment where everyone can bring their whole self to work. We’re energetic, forward-thinking problem solvers; come join our team! For more information on SageSure opportunities, visit www.sagesure.com/careers/. SageSure is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, gender identity, national origin or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Our Enterprise Data and Analytics group is looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing team in our Worcester Headquarters.  Position summary: This position combines advanced and creative technical knowledge with sound business acumen and judgment, based on solid experience with a range of business decisions to maximize profit and growth in a highly competitive marketplace. Demonstrates advanced statistical analysis skill, data mining, actuarial and/or research techniques combined with an intermediate level of understanding of Machine Learning techniques and a broader awareness of the business, general enterprise analytics, and the research community, to function in a collaborative and consultative role. Leads discussions with executives and management regarding the interpretation of research and its business inferences. Research undertaken has a potentially sizable dollar impact on pricing, marketing, finance, and risk management. May direct multiple complex research projects simultaneously as well as aspects of large and complex initiatives. May mentor more junior staff and direct their efforts. This is a full-time, exempt role.  Responsibilities/Essential Functions:  Data Management and Pre-Modeling:   Develops best practices around extracting, analyzing, merging and constructing databases.  Seeks new databases, including evaluation and acquisition of external data, software, and other tools in support of key strategic initiatives.  Consults on management information aspects of technology initiatives.  Identifies the appropriate data for analysis, anticipates integrity issues and other possible roadblocks, and understands potential future uses of data beyond the task at hand.  Directs, performs and interprets appropriate exploratory analysis such as data mining, empirical data analysis, univariate analysis, partitioning analysis etc.  Modeling Design & Monitoring:  Provides roadmap to design models using available data, tools and programming languages, supports the implementation in a real-world framework, and establishes monitoring processes to ensure optimal predictive performance over time.  Shares new ideas on advanced analytical techniques and their application to the business.   Project Management:   Provides and/or independently gathers requirements from appropriate business partners for project, including necessary data for analysis to be performed.  Guides implementation of models in real-world framework.  Develops and manages preliminary project plans, ensures optimal and effective execution on deliverables within agreed upon timeframes, monitors program milestones and critical dates to identify potential jeopardy of project schedules, identifies ways to remove obstacles, communicates progress and makes recommendations to address issues, and manages any effects on related projects.   Position Requirements:   Bachelor’s Degree required, preferred majors in math, statistics, physics or computer science or a similar analytical field.  5+ years analyst experience including the ability to work with large, complex databases.  Pro-active, inquisitive attitude - seeking to improve processes and reports to facilitate better decision making.  Expresses a desire to learn more about the business and to apply that knowledge to day-to-day work.  Solid understanding of database principles; experience in data manipulation and cleaning; experience in identification and resolution of data issues.  Advanced Excel skills and demonstrated experience in programming languages such as SAS, SQL, VBA, R, Python etc. Should be proficient in at least two of the following languages: SAS, SQL, R and/or Python.  Awareness of typical insurance data sources, both internal and external.   Key Competencies:   Business Enterprise Knowledge.  Creates an environment that encourages and values the opinions of others and promotes sharing of information and ideas.  Results Orientated.  Relationship Building.  Strategic Thinking.  Strong verbal and written communication skills.  Strong self-management skills; ability to manage multiple projects and timelines.  Proven ability in complex quantitative analysis.  Excellent problem-solving skills.  Detail-oriented.  Ability to multitask and meet all deadlines with quality product.  Identifies business problems, champions efforts/solutions and ensures appropriate monitoring. Company Summary Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it. Target Openings 1 Job Description Summary Business Insurance Actuarial and Analytics (BIAA) has an open Data Scientist position on the BI Analytics & Research Product team. This position includes hands on modeling and analytics work and has two key responsibilities. One is partnering with Risk Control to identify and execute on new analytic solutions that enhance Risk Control processes. The second is maintaining our GL Benchmark models with model refreshes as well as exploring enhancements through new variables or new techniques. The position works closely with business partners in Risk Control, Actuarial Product, BCO, and business unit actuarial teams. Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities Assist in design and development of analytical solutions. Share knowledge with the community through discussions, presentations, or peer reviews. Begin to set and manage expectations with business partners for small projects, and with guidance, identify potential conflicts and build consensus. Communicate analysis, insights, and results to manager, peers and business partners and with guidance, tailor communication to the audience. Become a mentor or resource for less experienced analytic talent, onboard new employees and interns, and provide support for intern recruiting and talent assessment efforts. Support various training and skill development initiatives Minimum Qualifications Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Decision Sciences, Actuarial Science or related analytical STEM field plus two years of experience or any suitable and equivalent combination of education and work experience. Heavy concentration in mathematics, including statistics and programming, business intelligence/analytics, as well as data science tools and research using large data sets. Additional verification of specific coursework will be required. Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge Masters in STEM related field or equivalent 3 years of related experience Strong working knowledge of modeling/ research/analytics or actuarial required Relevant statistical analysis work experience required Strong Knowledge of statistical techniques with the ability to read/revise/ review statistical software programs Ability to develop models and interpret model results Understanding of advanced statistics underlying data models Ability to apply emerging statistical procedures to work Strong knowledge in: Regression, Classification, Machine Vision, Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning and Statistical modeling. This position may be based 100% remotely or in one of our offices. Employment Practices Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We value the unique abilities and talents each individual brings to our organization and recognize that we benefit in numerous ways from our differences. job_title: Jr. Data Scientist, Data Engineering- Evicore
job_Description: About EviCore’s InQbator The Boston-based inQbator is a hub of healthcare innovation that solves problems at the nexus of patients, clinicians, and insurance providers. Originally founded as a healthcare startup spun-out of Partners HealthCare in 2012 and acquired by eviCore Healthcare in 2016, we have years of experience building solutions that streamline patient care, reduce the administrative burden on clinicians, and prevent wasteful spending in medicine. We're committed to making a difference in healthcare, and are looking for talented data engineers from all backgrounds to help us! What You’ll Be Working On The inQbator AI team has a mature ecosystem of solutions currently deployed to production that use state of the art natural language processing and machine learning techniques to bring tangible improvements to healthcare processes. Our near-term focus is on building solutions to address problems within the domain of prior-authorization, and our long-term problem space is incredibly broad and open-ended. As such, to identify the next generation of problems that we will tackle, we interact regularly with a diverse group of stakeholders that includes representatives from Cigna (eviCore’s parent company), Evernorth (the independent health services business unit within Cigna), clinicians and hospital networks (with whom we have partnerships), and ultimately the patients we seek to help. As a Member Of The AI Team, You Will Work closely and interactively with our data science and product teams to build data pipelines which support the eviCore inQbator Migrate legacy data ETL pipelines to cloud-based data platforms (Databricks, Snowfake) Develop new data resources which can be used for ML/NLP or product innovation Collaborate with various data stakeholders at Cigna/eviCore/evernorth to identify internal and external healthcare data resources which can be used by the inQbator Establish data engineering best practices for jr data engineers and data analysts Establish quality metrics which can be used for identifying value of inQbator projects Provide BI support for new inQbator innovations Keep current with industry advances in data engineering Solve problems that will have a positive impact on the health and well-being of many people Minimum Education, Licensure And Professional Certification Requirement Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, Math or related technical field Master’s degree preferred Minimum Experience Required 1-2+ years of relevant experience building data models, managing ETL pipelines, and driving data metrics Proficiency with SQL Experience with cloud-based data platforms (Databricks, Snowflake) Familiar with git source control Preferred Experience Experience working with ML or NLP teams Experience in python Experience with healthcare data (claims, EMR) Experience in the Healthcare Utilization Management space Experience with Tableau This position is not eligible to be performed in Colorado. Data Scientist – Pharm Sci & PGS Statistics and Analytical Research and Development Groups The Pharmaceutical Science and Manufacturing Statistics group supports a wide variety of activities in drug development and manufacturing spanning both new and marketed, chemical and biological entities. This position is located at the Groton, CT facility. The successful candidate will : Bridge statisticians, analytical scientists and partner line subject matter experts (database, informatics) to enable data connection with data-driven models and computational applications. Work with statisticians and analytical scientists to extract historical data and turn data into information for portfolio support. Cleaning and validating the data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and uniformity. Member of the community of data standardization/formatting, working with partner lines to identify use cases and good practice. Demonstrate leadership in influencing and improving workflows by identifying the data-analytics problems, and implement quantitative methods as needed to solve problems in pharmaceutical research. Requirements : MS in Math, Statistics, or Computer Science Knowledge of descriptive and inferential statistics models. Strong computational/programming skills: proficient in programming with R, Python, SQL or equivalent, knowledge of a variety of commercial statistical/computational packages, familiar with Linux, cloud computing and high performance computing environment. Demonstrated ability to independently develop and deploy statistical / computation applets using Python and R. Exceptional oral and written communication skills Good team player with demonstrated ability to build effective working relationships within and across sites with customers and partners. The flexibility to balance many projects and customers simultaneously. The ability to be independent and learn new skills quickly. Desired : Coursework in a scientific discipline (chemistry, biology, engineering). Prior experience working in pharmaceutical research and development. Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Spotfire or Tableau. Experience in ML/AI development and deployment.  Relocation support available Pfizer requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to the first date of employment. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. Boehringer Ingelheim is currently seeking a talented and innovative Intern to join our  IT M&S  department located at our  Ridgefield, CT  facility. As an Intern, you will  support the IT-M&S Digital Health Innovation Team in the development of machine learning algorithms for the processing of unstructured textual information from medical content: publications, customer service logs, posters, etc. Learning how to Report and document any finding under regulatory guidelines is an important outcome of this internship.   As an employee of Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery, development and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage lie with our people. We support our employees in a number of ways to foster a healthy working environment, meaningful work, diversity and inclusion, mobility, networking and work-life balance. Our competitive compensation and benefit programs reflect Boehringer Ingelheim's high regard for our employees   Duties & Responsibilities:   Assist in the management of project(s)  Learn data science topic, especially in the NLP discipline  Apply these learning to support the development of machine learning algorithms for the analysis (of) and insight extraction from unstructured text  Learn how to engage with business stakeholders for the collection of user requirements and run Design Thinking workshops As part of a development team, you will actively work on the development of A.I.-enhanced web applications in the medical field   Requirements:   Must be an Undergraduate, Graduate, or Professional Student in good academic standing.  Must have completed 12 credit hours within a related major and/or other related coursework.  Overall, cumulative GPA (from last completed quarter) must be at least 3.00 (on 4.0 scale) or better (No rounding up).  Major must be related to the field of internship.   Desired Experience, Skills and Abilities:  Familiar with project management concepts and techniques. Knowledge of Agile Methodology is a plus.  Understanding of data processing techniques for structured and unstructured data  The ability to develop classification, clustering, and embedded space models on textual data  Familiar with the concept of taxonomies (narrow/broader and equivalency relationships) is preferred  Hands on experience with Python  Hands on experience with Document Processing Services (Tika, Google Tesseract, Amazon Transcribe)  Hands on experience with AWS concept (lambda functions, SQS, Dynamo DB)  A good understanding of web application design & development  An undergraduate degree in Computer Science or Information Systems is preferred   Eligibility Requirements:  Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction.  Must be willing to take a drug test and post-offer physical (if required)  Must be 18 years of age or older  This position will require individuals to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved medical or religious accommodation. Click here for more information on the vaccine mandate and COVID-19.   Who We Are:  At Boehringer Ingelheim we create value through innovation with one clear goal: to improve the lives of patients. We develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company we focus on long term performance. We are powered by 50.000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture. Learning and development for all employees is key because your growth is our growth. Want to learn more? Visit boehringer-ingelheim.com and join us in our effort to make more health. Boehringer Ingelheim, including Boehringer Ingelheim Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Boehringer Ingelheim USA, Boehringer Ingelheim Animal Health USA, Inc., Merial Barceloneta, LLC and Boehringer Ingelheim Fremont, Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status, including protected veteran status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.  including protected veteran status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.   Boehringer Ingelheim is firmly committed to ensuring a safe, healthy, productive and efficient work environment for our employees, partners and customers. As part of that commitment, Boehringer Ingelheim conducts pre-employment verifications and drug screenings. job_Description: Data Scientist for  ConvergePROSPERITY, Deloitte Consulting  Are you looking for an organization with start-up spirit AND enterprise strength? Deloitte's ConvergePROSPERITY hybrid business offers both! You will be key member of the ConvergePROSPERITY Growth Engines team as a data scientist. ConvergePROSPERITY is hybrid business that is committed to partnering with our clients to enable financial security and prosperity for all. The Growth Engines team builds and manages solutions to improve customer relationships, enable accelerated acquisition, and improved customer stickiness.  You will help lead a team focused on developing cutting-edge quantitative solutions that address our client's most challenging problems in the financial services industry. You will be providing advanced technical leadership, guiding research and applications of quantitative methods, but will also provide direct supervision, mentorship, support, guidance, and oversight for the team. This is an exciting, hands on role that will stretch your knowledge and curiosity, offering the opportunity to deepen your skills, and solve novel problems.   Key Responsibilities:  Apply data science techniques to solve complex business problems  Explain analytics model behavior / results in the vernacular of the market need  Build, test, validate and demonstrate analytical models through various relevant error metrics and calibration techniques  Deploy models into production  Perform exploratory data analysis to define analytical models  Consistently strive to acquire new skills on AI / ML, Cloud, Big Data technologies  Support and coach your team on best coding practices, development tools, and pathfinding and surveys for technologies  Ensure SDLC best practices and standards are followed   Qualifications:  A BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or similar Quantitative Field with a minimum 2+ yrs. of experience as data scientist  An advanced degree in Engineering, Statistics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Computational Biology, Computational Chemistry or related quantitative field  Expert understanding of a programming language such as Python  Demonstrated ability to write high-quality, production-ready code  Demonstrated ability to develop novel machine learning methods that go beyond putting together of existing code, and to apply problem-solving skills to complex issues  Previous financial services industry experience  Proven ability to successfully collaborate with internal stakeholders from various levels and areas of the organization and drive successful outcomes cross-functionally  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Ability to work autonomously and collaboratively as part of a team to both teach and learn every day   Qualifications:  Experience with at least one Deep Learning framework such as PyTorch or TensorFlow/Keras  Familiarity with cloud computing services (AWS, GCP, or Azure)  Experience with product management or product marketing for software, analytics and/or SaaS-based products  Experience working closely with an engineering organization to define applications and manage them through the entire product lifecycle   Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. #ConvergePROSPERITY2021 #Converge

The job profile for this position is Data Science Lead Analyst, which is a Band 3 Contributor Career Track Role. This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.  Responsibilities: Manage model governance needs for business partners. Review model design, assumptions and performance as they relate to disparate metrics identified in our model governance framework. Provide guidance on mitigation actions. Work cross-functionally to enforce adherence to the model governance framework and provide ongoing support for enhancements to the methodology. Monitor and manage model governance KPIs of business partners around usage, disparity metrics and performance tracking Participate in ongoing implementation of the governance procedure and various efforts in model standardization, automation, and inventory management. Implement periodic model reviews and validation procedure for models in production.  Qualifications : Bachelors in Quantitative fields such as Mathematics, Decision Science, Operations Research, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Engineering or equivalent work experience. 2+ years of strong technical skills to extract and analyze data with proficiency in SAS, Python, or R. Strong understanding of statistics, probability theory, applied mathematics, and numerical optimization methods with broad exposure to modern machine learning models. Strong interpersonal skills and an outstanding ability to build relationships and navigate within a complex organization. Self-awareness, maturity, ability to collaborate as part of the multi-disciplinary team. Passionate self-starter to collaborate with stakeholders to establish trust & transparency in model life-cycles. Experience in established institutions requiring implementing regulatory and / or consensus-driven methodology and model validation guidelines preferred This role is WFH (Work From Home) which allows most work to be performed at home. Employees must be fully vaccinated if they choose to come onsite. This position is not eligible to be performed in Colorado. Overview: To be part of our organization, every employee should understand and share in the YNHHS Vision, support our Mission, and live our Values. These values - integrity, patient-centered, respect, accountability, and compassion - must guide what we do, as individuals and professionals, every day.  The Health Equity Data Scientist develops and implements strategies to support the analytic needs of the Yale New Haven Health System Office of Health Equity and Community Advancement. Provides leadership and direction of statistical analysis performed for the team, including analytic plans, evaluation, and assessment. Performs advanced data analysis using the Epic Electronic Medical Record (EMR) to generate insights useful to key personnel and outside organizations. Extracts and cleans large volumes of healthcare data across dozens of sources focused on clinical, operations, finance, population health, community health and social determinants of health. Applies expert statistical methodologies to investigate clinical outcomes. Partners effectively with health equity, care signature, community health, and population health teams, corporate leadership (IT, Operations, and Finance), clinicians, software engineers and other stakeholders to communicate findings using data visualization techniques. Uses knowledge of statistical theory, health services research and business operations to make recommendations to bring best practices to the Office?s projects and champions high standards and cutting edge analytic approaches.  EEO/AA/Disability/Veteran Responsibilities: 1. Provides direction for the analytic needs and approaches for all Office of Health Equity projects to ensure projects are underpinned by effective experimental design, analysis and interpretation of results. 2. Uses knowledge of statistics, programming and business operations to bring best practices to and champion high standards for Office of Health Equity projects. 3. Provides direction on the design, analysis plan, timeline and reporting of information on projects according to the business plan. 4. Consult with investigators and other research professionals at Yale New Haven Health System and Yale University with carrying out comprehensive statistical analyses and contributing to publications and presentations in scientific journals and meetings. 5. Develops, designs, and oversees all data management activities for the Office including database development, data integration, data integrity checks, data analysis and data reporting. 6. Responsible for the Office?s data security in compliance with Yale-New Haven Hospital/Health System, Yale University and funding agency policies. 7. Interfaces with other individuals internally and externally to achieve the Office?s project objectives. 8. Provides technical writing for grants and contract documents, reports and manuscripts. 9. Problem solve methodological/team/process issues that arise with analysts. 10. Trains and mentors staff in analytic methods. Qualifications: EDUCATION  Master's degree or higher in computer science, business, economics, mathematics, statistics, public policy, public health, biostatistics, or other related fields. Formal training in health services research methods is preferred.  EXPERIENCE  5+ years? experience and relevant competencies in statistical analysis of health outcomes research, or other relevant field. Extensive experience with CMS administrative claims data and big data analytics. Proficiency in key statistical techniques (predictive modeling, logistic regression, survival analysis, design of experiments, hierarchical modeling, data mining methods, and other advanced statistical techniques). Robust SAS or SQL programming experience working with complex datasets, and experience with Python and R. Experience with Tableau and Power BI.  SPECIAL SKILLS  Deep understanding of analytics and data wrangling in large data sets from multiple data sources. A working knowledge of database principles, processes, technologies and tools. Demonstrated quantitative and qualitative skills researching and analyzing healthcare issues. Ability to synthesize and summarize large amounts of information and to focus quickly on the essence of an issue. Works with autonomy to find solutions to complex problems using open source tools and in-house development. Working knowledge of computer software to support research project(s). Well-developed oral and written communication, statistical, organizational, and analytical skills that include the ability to bring applied knowledge to analytic questions. Develops and maintains relationships with business, IT and clinical leaders and stakeholders across the enterprise. Project management, supervisory and staff training skills. Demonstrated experience managing multiple tasks simultaneously that cover a broad range of technical areas and adhering to deadlines. Comprehensive knowledge of health care quality measurement methods and policy. Possesses advanced statistics and SAS programming skills. Ability and experience to perform independent/unsupervised exploratory data analysis and statistical analysis (e.g., ANOVA, regression analysis, propensity-score matched cohort analysis). Strong social justice and health equity interests.  PHYSICAL DEMAND  N/A

Company UST is a leading provider of platforms, digital innovation, artificial Intelligence and end-to-end IT & Business services and solutions for Global 1000 companies. We are transforming corporations through deep domain expertise, knowledge-based ML platforms, as well as profound anthropological efforts to understand the end customer and design products and interactions that create delight. We are deeply committed to developing a comprehensive understanding of our clients’ problems and to develop platforms to address them. Data Scientist Remote/Onsite Remote (Client Location)  :  Hartford, Connecticut. Fulltime/Directhire with UST Description: UST is looking for a Data Scientist who have experience in data analysis, data structure and modelling, data processing, data extraction and cleaning, working with a variety of relational and non-relational databases.  Requirements: · More than 15 years of overall experience required · Experience in Healthcare industry - specific focus on Medicare and STARS program · Experience in data analysis, data structure and modelling, data processing, data extraction and cleaning. · Experience working with a variety of relational and non-relational databases. · Experience working on developing end-to-end integrations. · Experience and understanding of communication and networking protocols. · Preferred to have experience with Tableau and/or Power BI. · Working experience with SAS is a plus. · Keen on understanding business requirements and zeal to learn any new technologies required for it. · Must be experienced working in a customer facing environment especially director levels · Must be a team player and as needed should be able to lead the team. · Experience working on BI projects. · Experience working in collaboration with other functional and technical teams working towards a common goal. · Experience in gathering requirements from business stake holders and communication of the same to technical teams. Responsibilities: · Developing and implementing an overall organizational data strategy that is in line with business processes. The strategy includes data model designs, database development standards, implementation and management of data warehouses and data analytics systems. · Identifying data sources, both internal and external, and working out a plan for data management that is aligned with organizational data strategy. · Coordinating and collaborating with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and vendors for the smooth functioning of the enterprise data system. · Managing end-to-end data architecture, from selecting the platform, designing the technical architecture, and developing the application to finally testing and implementing the proposed solution. · Planning and execution of big data solutions using technologies such as Hadoop. In fact, the big data architect roles and responsibilities entail the complete life-cycle management of a Hadoop Solution. · Defining and managing the flow of data and dissemination of information within the organization. · Integrating technical functionality, ensuring data accessibility, accuracy, and security. UST will provide relocation assistance.
